articles.author: Chris LowESPN Senior Staff Writer
articles.title: Rejoice SEC fans, your dreams have come true again
articles.description: The chants of S-E-C started early at the Sugar Bowl and after Alabama dominated Clemson there's no doubt which is the No. 1 league in college football. As the Tide prepare for Georgia in an all-SEC CFP title game, the chorus will only grow louder.

articles.author: Heather DinichESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: First look at an all-SEC national championship game
articles.description: Alabama and Georgia will meet at the epicenter of SEC football in Atlanta to battle it out for the national championship trophy. Here's what to expect.

articles.author: Tim MacMahonESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Rockets lose Harden for at least two weeks
articles.description: Rockets star James Harden, who has missed only two games since the start of the 2014-15 season and has never missed more than nine games in a season, will now be out at least two weeks due to a hamstring strain.

articles.author: Alex ScarboroughESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: UCF caps unbeaten season in triumph for Group of 5
articles.description: UCF caps undefeated season under Scott Frost and strikes blow for Group of 5 by showing it was better in all facets than SEC power Auburn.

articles.author: Bill BarnwellESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Barnwell's 2017 NFL awards: Picks for MVP, best rookies, more
articles.description: Will the GOAT get another MVP? Has Sean McVay's turnaround with the Rams done enough to earn him Coach of the Year? Bill Barnwell chooses the best of 2017.

articles.author: Mark SchlabachESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: Georgia, Oklahoma show us what a CFP semifinal should look like
articles.description: The Rose Bowl had everything: wild swings, contrasting styles, star performances and a thrilling finale, culminating in Georgia securing its place in the CFP title game.

articles.title: 2018 NFL draft order: Top 20 set; Browns have two picks in top four
articles.description: The top five picks for next year's draft: Browns, Giants, Colts, Browns (from Texans), Broncos. The order for the rest of the eliminated teams is set, too. Here's the top 20, plus the projected 21-32.

articles.title: NFL head-coaching carousel: Who's fired, who's hired, more
articles.description: There are jobs available in Chicago, Oakland, Indianapolis Detroit and New York, with more expected to open across the league. Here's your guide to current and potential openings.

articles.author: Dan GrazianoESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: NFL playoff primer: Bracket, Super Bowl paths, X factors, more
articles.description: The field is set, and the league's best 12 teams are in. Here's your guide to everything you need to know about the race to Super Bowl LII, from schedules to reasons for hope -- and concern.

articles.title: Grades, draft needs, offseason questions for every eliminated NFL team
articles.description: NFL Nation reporters grade the regular season for each team out of the playoffs, assess what positions each should target in the 2018 draft and look ahead to looming offseason questions.
